revisionDesc.change: Vote - AcceptText - Working together with James Cowey: lin7: ad slanting strokes after ιγ. => *slanting-stroke**slanting-stroke*; Gonis markup for diaeresis over iota is correct. Use of curved stroke to indicate diaeresis is a graphic convention. lin8: Gonis change good; lin9: <:(σχο̣[λ(αστικῷ)]) 10. φόρου =J. Keenan, BASP 9 (1972) 17/n8||ed|| (σχ[ολ(αστικῷ)]) 10. φόρου=BL 6.182|ση̣μ̣[εια]10.- φ̣ό̣ρ̣ο̣υ̣:> ; lin 15: in agreement with Gonis on leaving as in ed. pr. lin 18: Gonis suggests τ̣[ελέσω], we see τε̣λ̣[έσω] lin 17-18: we prefer 17a and 18a, since PSI online says that the two fragments do not join. James Cowey remarks that the two fragments may in fact join. See Sosin’s comments.

Vote - AcceptText - Note: text entered in "Save notes" does not get recorded in the "revision description" in the file. Justification should be (re)entered with submission notes. Gonis' comments were as follows: "There are traces of another line under l. 17, and of yet another line over l. 18, neither of them transcribed. || In l. 8 Φλαο̣υ̣ΐῳ should not be changed to Φλαυΐῳ (BL VI 182); pace BASP 9 (1972 ) 16, the combination αυ looks different elsewhere, and it would be prudent to reckon with omicron in between, however vestigial. || A name should follow ἐγγυητοῦ in l. 15 (cf. BL VII 238), but it's unclear if anything else was written in the line, so that it seems preferable to retain the text of ed. pr. || In l. 9 σχ[ολ(αστικῷ)] is after BL VI 182, but σχο̣[λ(αστικῷ)], suggested as an alternative in BASP 9 (1972) 17 n. 8 (not recorded in BL), may be likelier. Incorporated BL corrections in ll. 8, 10, 15, 16 31, 35 (but see also separate notes), all checked against the on-line image. I made a tentative corrective suggestion in l. 18, and another minor in l. 7. Corrected Ὀξυρυγχ(ειτῶν) to Ὀξυρυγχ(ιτῶν) in l. 14. Added supralinear bars over numbers in ll. 5, 6, 7, 35 (see image). Added some num tags." // lin7: Ed pr has strokes over both digits (ddbdp, per old practice, did not enter them); so, this correction should be backed out, or returned to Gonis in case he wants to press for different treatment of the curved stroke over the iota. Next voter, thoughts? For untranscribed traces below 17 and above 18=> 17. [.?]ει[.?] 18. <:vestige =PN N. Gonis (digital image)|ed|:> 18. lost.?lin 19. <:vestig =PN N. Gonis (digital image)|ed|:> 20. <:<:.1[.6]|alt|τ̣[ελέσω]:>=PN N. Gonis|ed|[.7]:>[ τῇ ][ὑμ(?)]ῶ̣ν̣ σοφίᾳ ὑ(¨)πὲ[ρ] (ἐνοι[κ(ίου)]) , and then renumber the rest accordingly ; lin18 τ̣[ελέσω] seems plausible enough (cf. e.g. SB 26 16722.4-5; 16755.19-20) ; Lin33 ; ‡2 => *x* ; ~la => ~grc-Latn (remember to include space after) ; rest of the suggestions seem acceptable and prudent to me; visible (where relevant) in online image: http://www.psi-online.it/documents/psi;8;963.
Automated transfer of accents across reg-orig pairs
batch converted all tei:sic to tei:orig and tei:corr to tei:reg
changed schema; added xml:space=preserve; indented; moved title/@n to idno
Converted from TEI P4 (EpiDoc DTD v. 6) to P5 (EpiDoc RNG schema)
